sense.name: season after winter
sense.commentary: SPRING[+event] The time of year when things start to grow.
sense.examples: The growth of new flower buds is a sure sign of spring. He's going to hold office until next spring.

sense.name: place of flowing water
sense.commentary: A particular location that contains a natural flow of ground water.
sense.examples: I drank from the spring and filled up my water bottle. John and Mary made plans to meet at the spring. The Vanderbilts only drink Poland Spring water.

sense.name: metal coil
sense.commentary: A device, usually made of metal, that returns to its original shape after being pushed or pulled.
sense.examples: John awoke the next morning to find that the springs on his mattress had broken. I bought my cousin a spring-loaded toy gun for Christmas.

sense.name: a jump
sense.commentary: SPRING[+event] A motion that propels something upward or forward.
sense.examples: My cat can reach the counter-top in a single spring. The action hero dodged the explosion with a well-timed spring to safety.

sense.name: elasticity
sense.commentary: The quality or degree of elasticity that an object has. Springiness.
sense.examples: John's Slinky had a lot more spring than mine.

sense.name: place of origin
sense.commentary: The point at which something begins or issues forth. Can be used physically or metaphorically.
sense.examples: We traced the leak back to its spring. All our ideas had their spring in John's brilliant insight. The creative spring of the Renaissance allowed a flow of new arts and philosophies.
